Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Blaster2001
Reviews.Content: This was no question a value and nice place to stay. My kids and I were comfortable and enjoyed the amenities. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again-Great Customer Service & WIFI”
Reviews.Author: HaveiPhoneWillTravel
Reviews.Content: 3 items 5+, for Location (AT&T, Motorola, Qualcomm) ,SUPERIOR HELPFUL STAFF, and WOW WIFI - furthest room on the 4th floor and had 100% connectivity. For those of us who need it that in itself makes this hotel a great bargain. The breakfast was fine with a different mix of items every day. Evening "meals" are what you expect for "free". The rooms are OLD and need to be updated....which I was told will be happening starting 3/12/12....much needed compared to other "suite" hotels. Would like a jacuzzi to relax in but that is a "want" not a need. I utilized the shuttle to go back and forth to work (AT&T offices) and they were super! "

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reviewers let me down”
Reviews.Author: GoesTo11
Reviews.Content: I travel to this area a few times a year for work and have stayed at a few different hotels. I will not be staying at this one again. Bad: Dirty furniture and floors, see pictures. Loud gas station and busy street outside, love being woken up at 6 to honks and trucks backing up. Ancient zenith TVs with terrible picture and reception. Very little sunlight in the Mira Mesa-facing rooms. AWFUL mattress, my back hurt every morning. Old decor. Good: Has a kitchen. Next to grocery store and food court. Free parking. Heated pool (no hot tub). Breakfast and snacks 5:30-7:30. Nice staff. I was only here 2 nights, I'd be depressed if I had to stay here for a long term assignment. But if you do, ask for a room facing the pool or rear of the hotel. The front, facing Mira Mesa Blvd is so loud, dark, and crappy view. My corporate rate was $199, which is way too much for this place . As a comparison, we pay the same as the Torrey Pines Hilton which is way nicer (you will pay $25 a day for parking at the dHilton). Or Drive a few extra miles to the Embassy Suites on La Jolla Village Drive if you don't need a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for short business stay”
Reviews.Author: sandy732
Reviews.Content: This suite is close to the business district (qualcomm and Motorola offices). Very hospitable staff and great breakfast in the morning. Also close to the super markets and shopping complexes. You could also use the complimentary shuttle service for short trips around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Safety and service aside, this hotel would have been the hotel for us while we were looking for a permanent place to stay here i”
Reviews.Author: arnecolus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have both been assigned to San Diego recently (since late August) as part of our company's expansion. We initially stayed at Residence Inn in a 2 bedroom suite for 3 weeks before deciding to move to Staybridge Suites in Mira Mesa, with similar amenities and accommodations. My wife and I initially thought that value wise it gives more bang for the buck. But just after one night we already had a scary and disappointing experience. First when we were getting ready for work, the closet door which should at least be 50 lbs heavy, fell on our 3 yo son while he was closing the thing after getting a pair of socks. We were scared s#*t upon realizing what happened. But when we realized it was just his toe that got hit, we decided to call the operator to send in the maintenance guy to fix the closet. Our son recovered and looks fine to me. However, when we came back to our room later that day, the house keeping did not exactly do what was supposed to be done, which is to clean at least the floor and replenish the coffee, soaps, shampoo and conditioners in both rooms. At least the house keeper took the tip we left at the table. So far it's disappointing now we're thinking of moving out by Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Suites San Diego - Sorrento Mesa hotel is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge Suites San Diego - Sorrento Mesa hotel is a very good hotel - but in need of a bit of a face lift. It has all the usual facilities you would expect from Staybridge - large, comfortable suites, good facilities and a lovely outside pool. The rooms and corridors leading down to them were in need of a bit of a facelift - but nothing too drastic (we were told that the hotel plan to do this soon - so it is very good that the management hotel realise this themselves). The hotel is located close to a main highway and this provides easy access to all the sites from the area. I have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: areuready
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice Staybridge. The living room decor was average and the furniture was average as far as comfort. The reason we chose this hotel was because it offered 2 bedrooms and 2 baths for our 2 kids at a reasonable price and parking was free. The breakfast was okay. They only had 1 waffle machine so the line could get long. We liked that the business center and laundry were free. We used both. The gym was quite small and the equipment was rather old. The location is AWESOME. It's right next to a shopping center that has lots of ethnic restaurants (Chinese, Thai, Greek, etc). Several miles down the street are Target, Best Buy and Chain restaurants. Best of all since we were military, we were close to Mira Mesa Base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & good service”
Reviews.Author: HoosierCFI
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently in a 1 queen studio room. Property looks fairly new and room was in good condition. Kitchen was a little bit small, and looked to basically be good for microwave and fridge only. You probably could cook on the stovetop, but would be difficult. Room was equipped with TV with all of the local cable channels and DVD/VCR combo. Bathroom is configured with the sink outside of the bathroom. Common areas were very nice and plentiful. Room includes semi-full breakfast. Would recommend that they do more of a completely full breakfast like Residence Inn. There was also a Sundowner service, but this also skimped a little, with it being Tues-Thurs, instead of the typical Mon-Thurs. One other small gripe would be the issue of no housekeeping on the weekend unless you request it. Seems a little cheap to not provide a towel change without requesting it. By the way, everyone at this property that I encountered was very friendly. I would stay here again, but for the rate offered, would hope that they would make these small improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Average Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTarHeel
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge Suites at Sorrento Mesa was on the whole a pretty average all-suite hotel that offers all of the standard services and amenities you would expect from this style of hotel. We stayed in a "Studio" which provided a queen sized bed and a sleeper sofa and only one room. Our 4-year old daughter had little problems sleeping on the sofa bed, but the queen bed for the adults was just average. Housekeeping services (their "light touch" room cleaning) are only provided Monday-Friday unless you ask specifically for a cleaning on the weekends. The property does a full cleaning upon check out according to their printed policy. Breakfast is provided every morning and a "Sundowner" service (beer/wine and a limited self-service dinner selection) from Monday-Thursdays. The food service, especially for breakfast, we felt was really geared toward their normal businessperson guests. At breakfast on the weekends we found the staff had difficulty keeping up with cleaning dishes and replenishing some food items in a timely manner. The food itself was of average quality for a breakfast-inclusive product. We picked this location based on being a midpoint between Carlsbad (Legoland) and the San Diego (SeaWorld, Zoo, downtown) attractions. This worked out for us fairly well, but traffic can be an issue around rush hours Monday-Friday as Mira Mesa Blvd. is a major suburban artery. We had no major issues and felt the hotel was safe, secure, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Great space”
Reviews.Author: 2and4makes6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late May. Room was well planned with plenty of space for 2 adults and 4 kids. View overlooking the pool was welcomed. Nice breakfast with lots to choose from. Pool and bbq area were very clean and quiet. Checked out early and they had a to-go beakfast bag ready for each of us. Excellent. Shops right next door and food court also. Great location

Reviews.Title: “At home! while on the road.”
Reviews.Author: hdbangr11
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at home! with the Staybridge Suites, San Diego - Sorrento Mesa in March of 2011. We had an excellent stay. There were so many things about our stay that were superior for the San Diego area: 1. The front desk staff try their best to greet you by name, and they go the extra mile with attentiveness, number of services, high quality of service, and communicating to you that it's their pleasure to do whatever they can for you. 2. Parking is complimentary, abundant, and in a wrap-around lot with safety features like bright lights and other businesses nearby. 3. The breakfast has rice! There are also plenty of dry items, cold foods, and hot selections. 4. Sport court with racket and basketball rentals, fitness center with dumb bells, and pool. 5. The new general manager is genuinely personable, and he does whatever he can to make things right if expectations are not met by guests. He and his wonderful staff from the front desk, to the grounds keepers, to the breakfast and sundowner reception staff, and to the housekeepers have won us over to not even think about staying anywhere else the next time that we go to San Diego. 6. We had a 2 bedroom suite - which feels like a well furnished apartment rather than a hotel room. One bedroom had a king bed with its own full bath. The other bedroom had a queen bed with its own full bath and a desk area. The two bedrooms were connected by a spacious living room with dining table, four chairs, couch, comfy chair, and a kitchen with two stove-top burners, utensils, bowls, pots, pans, full sized-refrigerator/freezer, etcetera. 7. Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday night they make a pile of food for all of the guests - no reservations required. Drinks too. All complimentary. Variety of things - while we were there it was greek food one evening, mexican food another, and burgers and hotdogs the other evening. Good flavors and variety. They don't call it a dinner, but we took it as that and thoroughly enjoyed it. 8. Looking around at all sorts of other discount websites and direct reservation systems for San Diego, La Jolla, and the like - no other place can match the Staybridge Suites San Diego - Sorrento Mesa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly reasonable suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: milst1
Reviews.Content: My wife and my sister-in-law and I traveled to San Diego for a couple of days of R&R and stayed two nights at Staybridge Sorrento Mesa, which seemed a good alternative to booking two separate rooms. We appreciated the two bedroom suite. The included breakfast was nice, as was the three times a week free dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful, although they had no good suggestions for places to go jogging. There is a fitness center, but the free in-room internet led us to Los PeÃ±asquitos Canyon reserve, which had great trails. Our room was clean and quiet. There were nearby shops and restaurants to which we could easily walk. One downside was that we left the "do not disturb" magnet up for our morning run, and apparently there is no room cleaning after the morning rounds. One other slight downside is the location in suburban San Diego, so you have to drive 20-30 minutes to get to the attractions closer to downtown. On the other hand, it's a shorter drive to Legoland. Overall, we were generally satisfied and didn't feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK...not great.”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: Currently here, but did not want to wait until I got home and forgot all of the "little things" that bothered me. Yes, it is a decent hotel. Yes, it is convenient from the freeway. But that is where the charm ended for me. We arrived at 10:30 p.m. to a nearly empty parking lot (on a Friday night during the Miramar Airshow weekend) and parked right up front. We checked in right away, utilized the 24/7 shop to buy some munchies after driving all evening and then tried to hit the sack. The shop is a really great thing that a lot of these "suite" type of hotels now do, but it is costly. Well, the first thing we noticed is that the people hanging out right below our second story window (outside on the patio) were talking. They were not loud or rude or obnoxious, but with the windows closed and the T.V. and A/C on, we could still hear them. Thin windows? No, it was probably because our room with two double beds was not made for TWO beds of any kind! One was shoved up against the window so my husband had to crawl over me to get in or out, thus we were quite close to the window! No one's fault, really. But it was sort of annoying. And when they mean double, they mean double - these beds are SMALL! However, they were comfortable. If you have a family of four, plan on using the sofa bed. If we had it to do over, we probably would have gotten the king with the sofa bed for the three of us. Two doubles are too crowded and too small! Second thing we noticed was that the A/C was extremely LOUD and made a horrible vibrating, humming sound when it was on. The kind of sound that makes your insides squirm. We just turned it off and finally fell asleep. But you can hear your neighbor's A/C when it kicks on! Sadly, our weekend event started at 7:30 a.m., so we had to be out of the room by 7:15. This stinks because breakfast is not served until 7:30 on the weekends! So, we did not get our complimentary grub! I did get free coffee though and it was good. The shower curtain was stained and torn and the walls were kind of dirty. The furniture was worn down and the couch saggy. The TVs are older with not a whole lot to choose from. The ceiling obviously had a leak at one point and they tried to fix it, but it still looked bad. The fitness center and laundry facilities were closed due to "issues" - but they said they had a back-up plan if you needed it. The elevator was filthy and the carpets in the halls wet with big fans running all afternoon and evening. Another leak? Overall, the place was just "OK." Not nearly as good as the reviews it has been getting. Mind you, I am picky, so if you want a decent place and don't care about the little things, this place will work just fine. I would likely choose to stay elsewhere next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable family hotel, good value for money - near main attractions and beaches.”
Reviews.Author: NorthantsAquababe
Reviews.Content: After spending ten nights in Anaheim and then four nights in Vegas, we arrived in San Diego for the last of our three stops in California. The hotel is easy to find, plenty of parking - the outside of the hotel looks very smart and modern, the reception was not quite so smart - but still very presentable including the large lounge, dining area. Although the hotel in general seemed although to be clean - a bit jaded and worn in places. We checked in quickly and efficiently, we were booked into a 2 bedroom suite on the fourth floor, so were not really bothered by noise at all. We were facing the outside area with the pool and basket ball court - so didn't have much of a view. The suite was spacious, plenty of room (we were there for 7 nights), the kitchenette was very tiny - but adequate. Breakfast provided each day was great - hot and continental, plenty to choose from - also a free dinner 3 nights in the week, which was also very good - although not much choice, it was still plentiful which made our stay very good value for money. We had our rooms serviced every day, what they called 'light housekeeping' - i.e. made beds, emptied bins, replaced used towels - which was more than enough. The pool area was good - never too busy, and towels were provided - our two teenaged boys enjoyed playing basketball, you could borrow balls from the reception. There was a business suite with free internet access which was very useful, a free laundry room, plenty of washers and dryers and quite a large fitness room. The hotel had plenty of restaurants in a small shopping centre next door which was very convenient, also a supermarket. Once we had got our bearings - it was quite quick and easy to visit the attractions in San Diego or to go downtown or to the beach. We went to both Delmar Beach and Torrey Pines State Beach - both highly recommended, very clean - the sea was quite rough and the waves big, so probably not idea for tiny children - but older kids would love it, and you could hire body boards in certain areas. The San Diego area is very pretty and is cetainly a very nice place to spend your holiday - plenty of places to visit and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 97tahoe
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about staying at this hotel do it!!!! We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Amenities and a good price”
Reviews.Author: jdieringer
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers more than the average "room with beds". The apartment-style rooms with kitchens and full appliances plus a coach offer much greater accommodation than a standard room. Overall many positives that rate this a strong recommendation and will return when back in San Diego. The key positives include good location, well managed, clean, nice appointments in the hotel. A great breakfast and an evening meal during the week are very nice additions. The drawbacks that keep it from a 5-star rating: No hot tub/whirlpool, older TVs, and your basic/small work-out room. Overall, a strong recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good to knows”
Reviews.Author: rkbzdsa
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this hotel for years now and it used to be a very good location. The rooms are always clean and the staff has always been very accommodating. Great little restaurants next door so if you don't want to go anywhere far, you don't have to. What I have found to be a really problem with the Staybridge these days is the new full-service carwash that sites right in front of the hotel. The carwash loud, the workers are loud and if you are one of the unlucky ones having a room in the front or the south side of the hotel and want to relax during the day, forget it. Buzz, blah blah blah, honk, honk, buzz, etc. So, make sure prior to signing on the dotting line you make sure your room in on the inside (courtyard) and as far away from the carwash as possible. I kinda dinged the staff for this in my selection of service. I made my arrangements 45 days in advance specifically requesting a courtyard room away from the carwash and you would like being a longtime loyal customer they would have been more accommodating but guess what: Buzz, blah blah blah, honk, honk, buzz, etc. and there were no other rooms to switch to. I had expected some courtesy and maybe a room rate reduction but that never happened. We would have moved to another hotel but my sons are with their travel team and we could not break up the pack. Breakfast is awesome! Again, demand a courtyard northeast room.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigpenny34
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7-day vacation and this hotel was wonderful. We had 2, 2-bedroom suites and it worked out beautifully. Plenty of room for the young kids to spread out and the kitchenette (no oven) with full-size fridge was perfect for our needs. The free hot breakfast every day, dinner on Tues, Wed, Thurs, and the free 24-hour coffee & tea bar saved us well over $800 for the week. Kick in the free washer and dryers (you supply the soap), no-fee parking and this hotel becomes a GREAT bargain. The location was fine for us since it was half way between Legoland the the Zoo/Sea World and La Jolla is only about 15 minutes away. A small strip mall with a some restaurants including Starbucks, Burger King, and KFC and a grocery store and a Bev Mo is just a few hundred feet away. Within a few miles you can find department stores (Target, Wal-Mart, Kohls) and tons of restaurants and a very nice and huge movie theater complex. We had to do some shopping and went to the movies one day and the location of these places made it very easy for us. The only negatives would probably be timing of housekeeping and thin walls. On 3 of our 7 days we called the front desk when our room hadn't been cleaned by 4:30. Not a big deal though and a on a couple of days we just swapped dirty towels for clean ones because we didn't really need a room cleaning. There were kids next door who were noisy at times but fortunately, it didn't happen very often and when it did my earplugs solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay for many reasons.”
Reviews.Author: bdgr94
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. Very impressed with the service , staff , and all that was made available to us. First, the free parking , you can't beat it. The grounds were clean , patio area and pool were great. Gas grills, full court basketball / tennis court too. We also took advantage of the fitness center and the guest laundry room. The breakfast was awesome; buffet style and the menu changed daily. Our room was clean and spacious ( 2 bdr with full kitchen ). Location is a little out of the way from downtown and other attractions, but if you have a car it's no problem. The surrounding area was quiet and very close to grocery and retail stores (Target,etc) Overall this hotel exceeded my expectations as did our entire time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliet298
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. No complaints whatsoever: clean, spacious rooms. Full sized fridge and microwave - great if you want to have breakfast in the room. Breakfast is basic, but good enough. Hotel is family friendly with a nice pool. Location is also quite good - a lot of restaurants, shops around, and not far from major attractions and theme parks. Room rates are reasonable and staff are nice and friendly. Overall - great hotel for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelinGal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old. Rooms are so dirty but the common areas like Elevator, halls, etc are gross! It is in a less than desirable area. The room smelled of bug spray. But the biggest issue was the fact that could clearly see that someone had gone looking through my suitcase and belongings while I was out. I reported it to the clerk at the Front Desk immediately upon my return. I had her come to the room so I could show her why I was so certain. She was young and while pleasant said that she would report it to the Managers who would return in the am. The next morning I stopped at the desk and was told the manager was not yet in, but was made aware and would be looking into when they got in. I never heard another word from them. The next 2 days I had to keep anything of value locked in the rental car. Not one single person in management checked back with me on the issue. I will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: juls97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in of of the Family Suites. It had 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, living room, kitchen. It was perfect for a large family. Their was also a complimentary hot full breakfast each morning and Tuesday - Thursday a complimentary hot full dinner. It was perfect especailly on a budget. I will definately seek out this chain of hotel when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: guyinAZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location--about 10 minutes from the 5 or the 15--make everything in San Diego easily accessible. A shopping center with some decent, mostly Asian restaurants (Tem's barbecue, open only for lunch, is a must) a bakery and grocery store, are a 2 minute walk. Rooms are spacious with a microwave, full-sized refrigerator, 2 burner stove and 10-cup coffeemaker. Breakfast was more than ample and the happy hour snacks were good. The staff were very helpful in mapping out destinations and always friendly when answering questions or making recommendations. The free parking, sometimes taken for granted, shouldn't be. I had to fork over $22 a day at the the Manchester Hyatt a few days later. The hotel's free laundry--with several washers/dryers-- was an especially nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2 bedroom hotel”
Reviews.Author: geebeebop
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great breakfast. We would stay there again. Good price for two bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: MChildress
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this particular Staybridge Suites. We absolutely love it! The rooms are always clean and roomy, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the food is good! We have 3 kids, so suites are the way to go for our family right now. The beauty of Staybridge is a daily hot breakfast, and Tues - Thurs (I think... maybe Fri?) they have dinner, too! The location is slightly north of the attractions in San Diego, however, it still only took us about 10-15 minutes to get to Balboa Park or Sea World. Legoland was about 25 minutes away, and La Jolla Beach was only 10 minutes away. There is a great shopping plaza next door with really great restaurants (Indian, Japanese, Greek, Thai, Mexican, etc), a grocery store (Fresh & Easy) and a great wine shop (BevMo). Target, Babies R Us, and many other larger stores are about 5 minutes' drive away. I truly think it is a great location!

Reviews.Title: “STAYBRIDGE SUITES ON MIRA MESA ROAD”
Reviews.Author: MAGINA5864
Reviews.Content: I visited San Diego for the first time with my sister and my 5 year old little boy. We paid a little more money to stay at Staybridge Suites on Mira Mesa Road but we were pleasantly suprised. We had a full kitchen to stock food (Von's Grocery store within 2 miles) for visits into the San Diego Zoo and Legoland, saving us tons of money. We had two seperate bedrooms for privacy. My little boy likes his time with mommy. I would recommend getting a 4th floor room so that you don't hear the kids running across the floors- especially if you don't have kids, this could be annoying. Otherwise the rooms are quiet from side- to- side. The morning breakfasts were filling and kept us going every day. The hotel offered 3 nights of dinners for us which was nice and saved us additional money. This hotel is located in a corporate setting so it was a little hard to find places to eat. Do your research before you get to San Diego on this one. One plus, we were always going against the traffic congestion when we left the hotel and came back to the hotel. Great benefts of staying here!!! We loved the staff. Very friendly and helpful. We could not have asked for a better vacation. FIVE STARS OUTTA FIVE!!!!! GINA

Reviews.Title: “A perfect home base for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Eve529
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and welcoming when I arrived, and the room was like a studio apartment, complete with a full sized fridge/freezer, dishwasher, dishes and cookware. There are also larger suites available. I had the smallest type, and it was perfect for my business trip. There's a great room for hanging out or meeting, a 24-hour business center, a free DVD rental-library (DVD/VCR players in the room!), and outdoor barbecues. Parking is ample. Breakfast is free and easy to "grab-and-go" so you can sleep in a little, and still get where you're going on time. They have free food in the evenings on Tues,Wed, Thurs. (e.g. hamburgers or "Greek Bites." There's also a Fresh and Easy market 200 yards away, where you can buy small portions are fresh food that you can cook in your kitchenette. Perfect location. This isn't near any san diego tourist stuff, but it's wonderful to get away from the crowds after a long day downtown. If you have business in Mira Mesa, Serrento Valley, or even La Jolla I would highly recommend staying here. It's quite homey and a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied--wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Momof6
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite that has 875 sq. ft and sleeps 8 people. We had plenty of rooom and the kids really liked having 3 TVs available! Our suite was very clean, everything worked, and I didn't notice any stains on anything. We ate the hot breakfast buffet every morning and never got tired of it. Some things were available everyday like the cold cereal, oatmeal, bagels, yogurt, scrambled and boiled eggs, toast, waffle batter to make your own waffles, juices, milk, soda, coffee, fruit--fresh and canned, etc. Then there was a main hot dish each day such as biscuits/gravy, pancakes and bacon, or french toast and sausage. We also enjoyed the evening meal which they had Tues-Thurs. It was also a buffet and we had Greek Bytes, hamburgers/hot dogs, and a taco/salad bar. There was always plenty of food to completely stuff my teenage boys and satisfied some fairly picky young girls. There were many other places to eat very close by, and you could even walk to the Fresh and Easy to buy your own groceries to fix in your room if you wanted--after all they have kitchens complete with everything except an oven. The pool was perhaps a little small, but very uncrowded. The laundry facilities were clean and completely free for guests to use. We even borrowed a video from the DVD library to watch in our room and that was free. With free parking, high speed internet and all of their other amenities, I have to say that we were totally impressed and happy with our stay here. The one negative thing I noticed was that you could hear noise from the rooms as you walked down the halls, but we never heard anything while we were actually in our room.

Reviews.Title: “clean, value for money, n free breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: 2travelornot2
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel as a package deal...and turned out to be a good deal indeed. The room was clean, with a fridge, tv and cooking facilities. The looby was quiet n nice. Attendants not pestering but available when needed. and the best thing was the breakfast ..complimentary and a lot of variety at that. The location is a bit away from downtown..but u r good to go if u have a car (rental) ...la jolla and torrey pines is close.. actually i didnt feel anything was far. and there are some good restaurants in the nearby shopping mall.. I tried the Indian restaurant for lunch and it for 6$ I got a great meal!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trchew
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent customer service always ready to help. There are lots of extra free perks with this place- hot breakfast, wireless, free business center with printer, exercise room. Rooms are very clean, and suites are nice with a complete kitchen. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hospitable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: esanjays96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the Fall for a family vacation. The folks at the front desk were ALWAYS very helpful. Having food available every morning and some evenings was a wonderful perk to this hotel. We also went to Legoland, Seaworld and the Zoo. All locations were easily reachable from this hotel. I actually liked a more out of the way location because it wasn't like living in a tourist trap. The kids used the pool and miniature tennis court. Both were clean and in good condition. The only issue we had was the water didn't drain from our sink, but when we called down for service, someone came up right away to fix it. Many good memories of this hotel. Would definitely stay again if I got the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: secretagentangie
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for Halloween night, and it worked out great! I had a few of my friends from SD over to hang out, and it was spacious enough for us to enjoy some time together before hitting downtown SD for some fun. It's in a great location, seeing how you could literally walk over to different restaurants and other shops (which my boyfriend and I did after I checked in. Try the new Mexican food place that used to be Cotixan's -- the carne asada fries aren't half bad!). It's also pretty quiet considering how it is located right next to a Shell gas station. Both my boyfriend and I slept through the night with no problems. I mention this because I remembered some previous guests who had complained about it being nosy at night. My boyfriend had a field day with the continental breakfast in the morning, which he of course ate in bed while I was still half asleep. He mentioned it was pretty good, so I assume it was pretty good as well. I never got to eat it -- I just got to smell it. Overall, we liked the room very much. Owned by Holiday Inn, you can expect a tightly run ship that's clean, roomy, and professional. I would gladly stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine...breakfast not”
Reviews.Author: GigemAggie
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Staybridge Suites and I stayed for three nights while traveling on business in San Diego. The hotel itself is nice and the rooms were clean. Free Internet access was provided (both wired and wireless) and both worked fine for me. What I didn't like about the place was the free breakfast. The choices were pretty limited and even though the main breakfast item changed daily, I seldom found anything I liked. There was always cereal, fruit, waffles, eggs, and oatmeal, toast, and bagels. The bagel I had the one day was stale. The eggs were just OK. The one day they served bacon, so I was happy, but the bacon was limp and seemed barely cooked. The lady working the dining area was not exactly friendly. They do have a social hour every Tue, Wed, and Thur, but I never attended those events. There was a Marriott Residence Inn not far from this location and I have always had good luck with this chain. Next time I'm in the area, I would try the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: we3travelalot
Reviews.Content: Wow! We are so impressed with this hotel! Great Service! Clean Rooms! Wonderful Breakfast! Very nice front desk- they upgraded us to a huge suite! Everyone is pleasant and helpful. The rooms are well maintained and have all you need for a long or short stay. Close to shopping and restaurants, close to freeways and La Jolla, very safe upscale area. Highly recommend this hotel- one of the best stays we've had in a long time! Thanks Staybridge! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay at the Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: TeriL
Reviews.Content: We booked a very last minute reservation at the Staybridge and were pleasantly surprised. We were in Disneyland and decided to spend an extra few days in order to visit our nephew who was just stationed at Camp Miramar and see some of the sights in San Diego. I found the hotel after a quick internet search for a hotel near the base. The staff was very helpful with giving us directions to places, information on restaurants, etc. The room was larger than I expected and the kitchen was well stocked. The continental breakfast was much better than our hotel in Anaheim offered! It was a bit hard to find a seat though because the breakfast was so well attended by hotel guests. Sea World was definitely a bit far. The mall at La Jolla was pretty close though. The staff was kind in allowing us to check out late after we were drenched by Shamu at Sea World and needed a quick change before we got on our flight! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingsAMust
Reviews.Content: Our baseball group stayed at the StayBridge Sorrento Mesa from July 1-5th. What a perfect set up for a team! The staff was very welcoming and made our stay pleasant. The hot cookies were wonderful for the hungry boys, and the complimentary breakfast and Sundowner reception was a nice bonus. The laundry facilities were also complimentary - a big plus for dirty uniforms to be laundered! We had a team barbeque on the 4th of July, and the staff was kind of enough to allow us to use their paper products, silver ware and condiments from their kitchen, as well as allowing us to use their grill tools. The rooms were clean and spacious. I would definitely recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Traveler Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: briguy73
Reviews.Content: This was probably my 15th time staying at this hotel. First off - I recommend that you sign up for the Priority Club if you are giong to be staying at this hotel or any of the other InterContinental Hotel Group hotels (Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza, etc.). This "frequent flier" club of hotels is the best out there!!! Now - on to the review. Since I have stayed at this hotel so many times, I thought it was about time to share my experiences with the rest of the world! Every time I have stayed here, including this past one, I have to say that their customer service gets better and better! From the front desk staff to the lady running the breakfast buffet - they really try to make you feel like family!!! I don't like sounding like a clichÃ©, but it's true! When I say it is a good hotel for business travelers, I don't want you to think it is specifically for business because it is not!!! This hotel is in an area that really doesn't attract the typical family vacationers... It is in a business area in Northern San Diego County. The rooms are large and all have a full kitchen in them with dishwasher, refrigerator, stove and sink. The cabinets are even stocked with the basic kitchen items - glasses, plates, bowls, cooking utensils, pots, pans, etc. Comes in handy if you are trying to cut your expenses and cook instead of eat out every meal! The beds are very comfortable and I seem to get some of the best nights sleep at this hotel than any other hotel I have stayed at. Every morning, there is a free breakfast buffet down in the lobby. This isn't just your typical danish and coffee breakfast. They have hot scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, waffles, and a daily special. When I first started staying here several years ago, this was a very extensive breakfast and has since scaled back a bit but still adequate! Very nice touch! If you are staying during the week, particularly a Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday night, you have the opportunity to take advantage of their "Sundowner" event in the evenings. These take place from around 5:30 to 7:00pm on these nights and include a nightly special appetizer that can very well replace dinner if you don't feel like going out. To top it off, they include free wine and beer and soft drinks at this event!!! How can you beat that? Besides the typical hotel amenities, this hotel also has a back courtyard with barbecues you are allowed to use on a first come first served basis, half basketball court, and a very nice swimming pool. In all, I consider this hotel to be my good old reliable, you know what you're going to get, hotel. I really appreciate their customer service, attentiveness to problems, and how they go out of their way to make you feel at home. This is really a quality in hotels and just about anything anymore that seems to be going away. Because of this, this hotel, along with the rest of the chain, have earned a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Girlypanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night for New Year's Eve at the Staybridge Suites-Sorrento Mesa. Check-in was quick and the employee checking us in was quite pleasant. As priority club member, I was offered a late check-out at 2 pm. Our 1 bedroom king suite was clean and in good shape on check-in. Breakfast the following morning had a big variety with eggs, make your own waffles, fruit, pastries/breads, cereal, yogurt, etc. We used the wireless internet in our room and had no problems with the connection. Overall, we had a very nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “taking advantage of fire evacuees”
Reviews.Author: slob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were evacuated from the San Diego wild fires in October. When we checked out of the hotel we found a charge for local calls. 1 was for $20 for 30 minutes while calling my insurance company to get help for fire damage and lodging expenses. The other calls were for less than 30 seconds and were to reassure friends and family we were safe. The phone charges were $2 and $3 for each 30 second call. I contacted the manager but he never bothered to call back to explain why they took advantage of fire victims.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and calm, friendly and qualified staff”
Reviews.Author: Californiafriend
Reviews.Content: Hotel: San Diego, Staybridge Suites Sorrento Mesa Date: November 3, 2007 Reviewer: Family from Germany We are a German family and we planned a 19-day-holiday trip to San Diego, California in August 2007 together with our 25years old son. Beginning of 2007 I started to search a hotel in San Diego at a silent location close to San Diego Downtown, the beaches and all the popular sights of the city. Using the internet I found the homepage of Staybridge Suites Sorrento Mesa. The presentation of the hotel at the homepage is excellent and gave me a complete description of the hotel and all necessary information. I booked a 2 bedroom suite. The price was fair and all of our expectations were fulfilled when we arrived at the hotel. The suite has a big living room with TV and VCR and a fully equipped kitchen including fridge, freezer, oven and microwave. The two separate bedrooms gave enough space for my son in one bedroom and for my wife and me in the second bedroom. Each bedroom has a private bathroom, its own TV and VCR. The suite is spacious with good furniture, clean, comfortable and quiet at night. The hotel is located in a very clean and calm neighborhood with many restaurants, grocery stores and gas stations. The hotel is new renovated and well maintained. Room service is very good. Due to the good connection to the Interstate Highways 5 and 805 all of the famous attractions like San Diego Zoo, San Diego Downtown, Sea World, the harbor, Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town, Coronado, La Jolla, the beaches, the Mexican border and much more can be reached in less than 30 minutes. The hotel offers a good complimentary breakfast with many hot items like sausages, scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes and all kind of beverages. The breakfast room is convenient, clean and comfortable. There was also a really big deal of extra value. At three days a week there was a complimentary dinner, called â€œSundowner Receptionâ€� with good dishes. The reception desk offered fruits and fresh baked cookies every day. There is a separate business room with free access to computers and free wireless internet access anywhere in the hotel. A lot of amenities like swimming pool, basketball court, barbeque grill, fitness center and laundry facilities make the stay very convenient and comfortable. Staff is qualified, experienced and very friendly every time. I would highly recommend this hotel because of its great value and good location for private and business stays. It is competitive with hotels in Europe and meets international standard.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome! Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: utting
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a vacation to San Diego. We stayed five nights in the Staybridge Suites Sorrento Mesa. We booked a two bedroom suite. There was more than enough room for my husband and I and our two daughters (ages 10 and 7). My daughters loved having their own bedroom complete with their own private bath, television and VCR. All rooms, including the master bedroom, are good size and the beds were comfortable. The hotel was quiet at night and well maintained. The pictures on the hotel website are very accurate to depict where you will be staying. This hotel is located in a great area. It is a newer hotel in a nice, clean part of town. A wide selection of restaurants, gas, and grocery stores are all nearby. The hotel is also convenient to the main highways. We visited Legoland, San Diego Zoo, Coronado and La Jolla during our visit. Nothing was more than 15-25 minutes away. For the price, this hotel is full of extra value. The complimentary continental breakfast was great. Always well stocked and offered rotating "hot" items each morning. Scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage patties, bacon, etc. This was in addition to pastries, cereals, bagels, toast, juice, etc. When we returned to our hotel at night, we often found complimentary fresh baked cookies or apples at the front desk. They also serve a complimentary dinner three nights during the week. Other extras include free access to computers and the internet. Free DVD rentals at the front desk. Onsite basketball court and pool, fitness center and washing machines. Staff was very friendly and always willing to answer any questions we had. I would highly recommend this hotel to a family planning a vacation in the San Diego area. We are very picky about our choice of hotels. The Staybridge exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dstx4
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge is absolutely wonderful! The rooms are immaculate! The staff was outstanding! The manager gave my kids a slinky toy and my kids were hooked. The breakfast buffet was really good with make your own waffles, a toaster for bagels and toast, oatmeal, fresh fruit, eggs, and the "special of the day". Our first day it was breakfast burritos, then biscuits and gravy, and then french toast. On Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday they have dinner get togethers with wine and ale. We had the turkey sandwiches which were excellent! The hotel is conveniently located next to a group of restaurants, just outside. Then the next 4 - 6 blocks there are stores, restaurants, a bowling alley, movie theater, etc. It was like a home away from home. We didn't go in the pool, but the fitness room had weights, 2 treadmills, an elliptical, bike, and weights. There is free laundry but the dryer was not that hot. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and we enjoyed every minute at the Staybridge!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of free extras”
Reviews.Author: MarionMcD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sorrento Mesa Staybridge Suites in San Diego for 2 weeks during February 2006 while working on business in the area, and was very pleasantly surprised. The breakfasts were both generous and tasty, and the rooms were of excellent size with well-supplied kitchens and bathrooms, but what really made the hotel stand out were the number of extras they offer as a matter of course. Laundry facilities were provided free of charge, a free evening meal with complimentary wine or beer was provided every Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday night, and the hotel's shuttle service offered free transportation to any location within a 5 mile radius. The hotel also offers a gym, swimming pool, basketball court and wifi throughout the great room and outdoor courtyard. Fantastic. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “tranquility after hectic Disneyland!”
Reviews.Author: rotterdam
Reviews.Content: We (family of four with two sons of 9 and 16) stayed at the Staybridge Suites Sorrento Mesa the first week of januar. It was a haven of peace and tranquility compared to our stay in Anaheim/Disneyland. Sure, we were warned about the enormous masses visiting Disneyland, but we never expected Disnelyland to close its doors for several days in a row, completely full! The suite we booked was a two-bedroom suite (with ample space for all of us). There were some minor problems with shower and bathroom which were quickly dealed with. The grounds were beautiful, for most of the time we had the swimmingpool to ourselves. The fitnessroom was also in demand, a bit small but as we were the only ones using it: enough space for us. The breakfast, included in the price, was very nice. Each day there were other items presented at the buffet, the waffles were a big hit with us. After a day at the Zoo or Seaworld is was nice to have a drink in the lounge (managers cocktail tuesday-thursday). Next door there is a small shopping center with several restaurants. We especially liked the Japanese restaurant, they served al lovely lunch (also take-out) for a very decent price. The location of the Staybridge worked out fine for us, no more than 20-30 minute drive to all the main attractions. One of the highlights of our tour was visiting La Jolla, we took a long walk along the coast (beautiful views). We highly recommend the Staybirdge suites for families with childeren visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for week at the height of the summer vacation season. The hotel was fully booked. I travelled with my 2 small children and husband, and had a wonderful stay. The suite was nicely equipped with extra luxurious touches. every evening there was a free sundowner buffet with light meals between 5 and 7pm. The kids enoyed hot dogs before getting cleaned up after a day at the beach, and us parents could have a beer or glass of wine. The week's free buffet breakfast and sundowner menu was put on our fridge when we arrived. The highlight for me was the professional staff -- very courteous and helpful. I especially appreciated it that the staff made sure that unsupervised children's chaperones were firmly reprimanded if children running wild in the hotel were causing discomfort to other guests. This place is highly recommended, and if you visit the San Diego tourist attractions, you will almost always be travelling in the opposite direction to the rush hour traffic, dut to its location uptown. we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with my elderly parents and wanted a hotel with a 2-bedroom suite instead of traditional, separate rooms. With a 2-bedroom suite, each couple had privacy [bedroom and bathroom] yet a common living area to watch TV and relax. A bonus was the hot breakfast buffet included with our rate; it was great! The hotel looks brand new and is decorated beautifully. The location of the hotel is a couple of miles off the highway but for the price we paid, it was worth a little extra drive time. We were still close to La Jolla and the ocean. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not great...but not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug073Toronto
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean room, spacious, friendly service. Cons: Sofa bed was terrible and useless unless you are a small child, hotel was noisy (noise travelled easily from the hallways into the rooms, and also between the rooms), buffet breakfast was mediocre but enough to get you started for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, we thought”
Reviews.Author: AKBBristol_England
Reviews.Content: Decent sized suite. Breakfast pleasant, though it paid to get down there early. Quite a quiet area (nearby restaurants tended to close early, as the hotel is out of town). Probably not comparing like with like, but you would not find a hotel of the this standard in the UK for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about!”
Reviews.Author: langtry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights during the last leg of our trip to California first week of August and picked it because of the great reviews it got on Tripadivsor but sorry to say felt let down when we got there. Our room had a view of a car park and petrol station! The rooms are ok, just normal hotel-chain standard and although I would say they were clean I definitely could not say they were pristine. The bed linen on our king bed had faded stains on them and sorry but I like my hotel bedlinen pristine white. The pool was extremely small, almost plunge pool size but fortunately wasn't overcrowded at all despite the hotel seeming so full (lots of teenage soccer teams staying) but thankfully this wasn't an issue for our two kids who love to be in the pool a lot. You need to be aware that the location is near an Airforce base and there were lots of jets screaming past overhead when we were using the pool - very loud! The hotel offered complimentary breakfast and sundowner appetizers but both were of poor quality and if you didn't get to breakfast before 9am (+ we didn't), there didn't appear to be anything left in terms of pastry and bakery items or yougurts, plenty of bread for toast and boiled eggs etc + cereal if that's what you want. We had a problem with a blocked toilet cistern within the first hour of checking in but the girl at front desk said she had no-one to send up so she offered the plunger to my husband to use himself (nice!) this might be a problem for some people. I did use the free guest laundry facilities and my husband used the small gym which were both good. The sofa bed for the kids was unmade (I did expect it to be made up as I made the reservation for 2 adults and 2 children) and I had to ask for extra blankets and pillows to make it up, also it was very hard with a really cheap mattress and hard springs and my 8yr old daughter complained it was uncomfortable despite my best efforts at making it softer for her to lie on by placing an extra blanket beneath the sheet. It really WAS horribly uncomfortable. On the whole, the bedlinen was below standard, I hate those nylon-type bedspreads, yuk - they're so cheap and nasty - NOT want we want. Toiletries for the bathroom were sparse - 1 tiny bottle of shampoo & 2 bars of soap and no shower cap and the 'light' cleaning was only the bedmaking and change of towels. I accept the toiletries are replaced but on first impressions it looked a bit mean. The hotel location was good if you wanted to visit Del Mar and La Jolla but definitely not anywhere near downtown San Diego which was a minimum 20 min drive south on a slow highway so don't stay here if you think it's San Diego. This was not a 'terrible' experience but judged on our overall experience I would not stay here again and would research my location more thoroughly. I would agree with the review that said the hotel was under-staffed - there just didn't seem to be a lot of staff around! You can definitely do better than staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: orchidboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 07/30 to 08/02. There were a number of kids soccer teams staying at the hotel. It was a little loud, but not out of control. Room was nice and very clean. The staff was great. We enjoyed the location with lots of places to eat real close. Getting around was easy. Pool was a legit eighty (80) degrees. The breakfast was a pleasent suprise. No parking issues. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as Residence Inns or Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were persuaded to try this hotel after reading so many positive reviews. While there were some positive attributes, the hotel doesn't compare favorably with Residence Inns or Embassy Suites. Perhaps it's under new management, but it certainly doesn't deserve all the raves on this site. We will stick to Marriotts or Embassy Suites from now on. First the positives: the pool and basketball courts were nice and welcomed by my family; the free laundry facilities were nice to have after a week on the road (and surprisingly available); the location is convenient to attractions in La Jolla, Del Mar and north San Diego and not too inconvenient to downtown (although lacking in any real San Diego "flavor"). The negatives, which we feel outweighed the positives: The one-bedroom King Suite was very small. There was barely room to lay out suitcases for our family of four and have room to walk. The pull-out couch in the living room extended completely to the television cabinet so that it was impossible to make up (the bed was not made up and we had to request mattress pad, sheets, blanket and pillows to do it ourselves). Furthermore, the mattress was so uncomfortable that we had to pull it off the bed frame and lay it on the floor. The sleeper sofa was an obviously cheap piece of furniture and has not worn well. The bed linens for the king bed were so worn out and scratchy that it felt like sand in the bed. When will hotel chains realize that customers won't tolerate uncomfortable beds and linens? The lay-out of the bedroom was also most inconvenient. The bathroom door opened into the closet so that trying to get into the closet and maneuver around the bathroom was awkward. The doors to the outside hallway are so thin, you can hear every word spoken and every TV. The hotel was nearly full, yet management had only assigned one poor woman to manage the breakfast "buffet". The food was of poor quality, there was not enough of the hot (microwaved) food and no employee was assigned to clear tables or empty overflowing trashcans. We opted to purchase our own cold cereal and poptarts so as not to have to deal with the mess! I felt sorry for the woman who had to handle nuking the food and refilling everything by herself each morning! Overall, I'd say the property is poorly managed and understaffed for the size of the hotel. However, even improved management and new bed and bath linens cannot compensate for the lack of size and cheap furniture in the "suites." Skip this one and head to the Residence Inn across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to all SD attractions”
Reviews.Author: It's a Red Sox Nation
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in downtown SD, it never claimed to be. Yet, it remains a great location near 3 different interstates which is wonderful when visiting SD proper, Legoland, Wild Animal Park, and the dessert/mountain region. The boulevard offers convenient retail and food locations. The room was clean, spacious, and quiet. Breakfast was good on the weekday but continental food choices were sparce on the weekend. My only complaint is that the staff was less than friendly. Smiles were rare but staff was helpful when asked. I will return here if my travels every take me to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: gwynshees
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July for three days with my family of five, including three teenagers. We really appreciated having an apartment with three rooms instead of the usual two. It was the best accomodation we had on our three weeks holiday to the West coast. The staff were super friendly, we all enjoyed the midweek sundowners, breakfast and tuck shop - a great bonus for hungry kids. The pool and patio area were exceptionally nice - our three made great friends there- and they enjoyed playing sports outside. The large lounge was a delight to chill in especially as there was tea and coffee there on tap(it seemed designed in the manor of an English country house). It was great having the laundry facilities completely free of charge - we didnt even have to buy detergent. The only downside was the distance from San Diego - about 30 minutes along the freeway! As for facilities nearby we didnt go to the shopping centre but the numerous takeaways were great for a quick bite to eat. The hotel seemed to be used by business types, families and a very well behaved youth sports team the week we stayed and as far as I could see they seemed to be coping with everyone. All in all a great place to stay but be prepared to drive everywhere apart from the local shops!

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have relied on trip advisor for almost 2 years for the best accomodations and this is the first hotel I have been GREATLY disappointed with. My husband and I travel all over the country every couple of months and we do not see why this hotel was rated so high in San Diego. We seriously think the reviews must have been written by the hotel sstaff members and family. When we first arrived I was about to put my daugher on the bed and there was a big yellow stain on the sheets. I had to call housekeeping right when we arrived. The kitchen was tiny and very misleasding from the pictures on the website. The location of the hotel was NOT 15 minutes from Seaworld and tha airport. You had to get on 3 different freeways just to get to this hotel. The drive was about 30 minutes with all the traffic because it's located in an industrial area. The next two days were even worse. The housecleaners never cleaned our room the first night we were there and for the 2nd day we came back to our room around 4:30PM and our room was still not cleaned. It was quite upsetting with the service we were recieving. To top iit all off the air conditioner leaked all over the rug in 2nd bedrrom suite. The maintanance employee said it has been a problem with the other suites. I would NEVER stay here again. I would recommend others to spend your money elswhere because this hotel has been overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Business Travelers or Light Sleepers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the hotel has improved since my stay, but just in case... First, you should know that if you book a stay online, you are CHARGED for the first night - no refund. I had planned to stay for 5 days. I had to be up early for a business conference. I called the hotel about two weeks before my arrival to make sure that I had a quiet room. I was assured that it would not be a problem. It was. The front of the hotel was on the same side as a main traffic street (Mesa Blvd). The windows were nowhere near soundproof so open or closed, all the traffic noise came in. When I asked to change rooms, there was a sense that they didn't try too hard to find a different one, so I was stuck for the first night. I thought that it might be ok, it wasn't. If you don't mind traffic noise, an unusually loud refrigerator and the charge whether you like the room or not [stay or leave]...... I called the Marriott Residence Inn's toll free number. They found me an excellent room, at a lower rate, so I repacked the car and left the next day. I highly recommend the Marriott Residence Inn in Sorrento. The room was nice. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for light sleepers, business travelers or people who like sincerity in their hotel managers.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Owners Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is noted to be pet friendly, we realized that our indoor cat had contracted fleas while we were there for the one night. We bathe & brush her and take her to the vet regularly and never once found anything in the 2 year we've had her. We took her everywhere, even overseas, and she didn't have this problem. We stayed at the Extended Stay in CA for a month with no incidents of fleas. Just want to warn other pet owners of our experience. Even though the hotel was nice, the breakfast was good, and the staff was friendly, I won't go through the flea experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!!! Everything a family would want was available. Nice pool, 2 grills for your use, laundry facilities, the "happy hour", extensive breakfast, too much to list. We had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom/2bath suite, even without this upgrade I would have had no complaints - very clean and staff was very courteous. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: SteveLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem. The rooms are very well equipped and spacious and the staff are very friendly. Coffee, dishwater tablets and toiletries were replenished daily. Everytime we walked into reception we were greeted. The clean heated pool is set in beautiful gardens, towels are supplied and there are tables and chairs to dine alfresco. The hotel provides two large gas barbeques and three nights a week complimentary evening snacks, wine, beer and soft drinks between 5.30pm and 7.30pm. The hotel is adjacent to fast food outlets and is close to the freeway into downtown, Seaworld and beautiful La Jolla. Breakfast is simple but plentiful and the whole place has a feeling of home from home to it. We loved it and would highly recommend this place to couples or families who want a value for money hotel without compromising standards.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites San Diego - Sorrento Mesa
HotelInfo.Address: 6639 Mira Mesa Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92121
